state.name: VGS=0 VDS=0
state.p: The conductivity of the path from source to drain is controlled by applying a voltage between the gate and the body of the semiconductor.
The electric field produced by this voltage is transmitted through an insulating layer of silicon dioxide.

state.name: VGS=0 VDS=1
state.p: Applying a voltage between drain and source with zero VGS will result in (almost) zero current since the p-n junction between the n-doped drain and the p-doped substrate is reverse biased.

state.name: VGS=0 VDS=sat
state.p: The only effect of increasing VDS is to increase the width of the depletion region around the drain.
The current is not exactly zero. Just as with the semiconductor diode, a small reverse saturation current will flow across the reverse biased p-n junction.

state.name: VGS=0 VDS=10
state.p: The only effect of increasing VDS is to increase the width of the depletion region around the drain.
The current is not exactly zero. Just as with the semiconductor diode, a small reverse saturation current will flow across the reverse biased p-n junction.

state.name: VGS=2 VDS=0
state.p: Increasing VGS produces an electric field that repels holes in the p-doped substrate to uncover bound, negatively-charged acceptor atoms. The field also attracts mobile electrons from the n-doped source and drain regions and any minority electrons in the substrate. An n-type conducting channel is established beween the souce and drain regions (once VGS>VT). This is called the inversion layer.

state.name: VGS=2 VDS=1
state.p: Increasing VDS means that the voltage between the gate and the channel is smaller at the drain end than at the source end.
With VGS=VT, the inversion layer is only just established. The channel is therefore pinched off by the reduced field strength at the drain end and no current can flow.

state.name: VGS=2 VDS=sat
state.p: Increasing VDS means that the voltage between the gate and the channel is smaller at the drain end than at the source end.
With VGS=VT, the inversion layer is only just established. The channel is therefore pinched off by the reduced field strength at the drain end and no current can flow.

state.name: VGS=2 VDS=10
state.p: Increasing VDS means that the voltage between the gate and the channel is smaller at the drain end than at the source end.
With VGS=VT, the inversion layer is only just established. The channel is therefore pinched off by the reduced field strength at the drain end and no current can flow.

state.name: VGS=5 VDS=0
state.p: A larger VGS increases the number of mobile electrons in the channel, increasing the depth of the inversion layer.

state.name: VGS=5 VDS=1
state.p: For small VDS, the drain current increases linearly with drain-source voltage. As with the JFET, this is called the ohmic or linear region.
The voltage between the gate and the channel decreases from VGS at the source to VGS-VDS at the drain. As a result the inversion layer is tapered - deeper at the source end than the drain end.

state.name: VGS=5 VDS=sat
state.p: At the pinch off point the inversion layer depth at the drain is reduced to zero. The voltage between the gate and the drain end of the channel (VGS-VDS) is now equal to the threshold value VT.
The increased channel resistance results in ID flattening out in the saturation region.

state.name: VGS=5 VDS=10
state.p: As VDS is increased further, the pinch off point moves towards the source, reducing the effective length of the channel and increasing ID slightly.
This effect is called channel length modulation and results in a slight linear relationship between ID and VDS in the saturation region.

state.name: VGS=10 VDS=0
state.p: A larger VGS increases the number of mobile electrons in the channel, increasing the depth of the inversion layer.

state.name: VGS=10 VDS=1
state.p: The increased depth of the inversion layer reduces the resistance of the channel so the drain current is larger for the same drain-source voltage.

state.name: VGS=10 VDS=sat
state.p: Saturation is reached with a larger VDS since a larger drain-source voltage is required before the depth of the inversion layer at the drain is reduced to zero.

state.name: VGS=10 VDS=10
state.p: In the saturation region, the MOSFET behaves as a current source, with ID independent of VDS and controlled by VGS.
